by Vladislav Kulchitski

*

Where do all the hours go?

"

  • back
    to archive

Homeâ€º f1vlad's blog archive

I've discovered quite interesting web/social service that sits in your tray and tracks what software and web applications you use and how much time you spend doing it — wakoopa.com.

At the time I installed it on my work laptop and home desktop (that is mainly used as home entertainment), I didn't realise how insightful it will become in representing, to me, what I do online; particularly, how many precious hours wasted on such things as facebook, twitter, and so forth. Although likely not very accurate, it still shows a good general trends picture in my opinion.

There's always times when you await on something to compile or a sandbox build for instance. So you could sit idle awaiting that for few minutes at a time. Why not check twitter? Or facebook? Or perhaps reader.google.com? Wakoopa simply shows, among other things, how many hours one could accumulate from such little visits!


Balance your media diet (from WIRED MAGAZINE: ISSUE 17.08). Illustration: Jason Lee.
